# Style and Compliance Checklist Template

.GitHub: Documentation Change issue template â†’ [./.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/documentation_change.md](/mnt/data/000000009d2c722fb67874052aec30e5)

## Purpose

Define the objective of this checklist and when it must be used.

## Documentation Style Checklist

* Formatting aligns with project standards
* Headings follow required hierarchy rules
* Required metadata is present
* Terminology aligns with organizational glossary
* All links validated
* No restricted characters or banned punctuation used

## Compliance Checklist

* SPDX header included and correct
* Licensing aligns with project policy
* Regulatory or jurisdictional requirements met
* Security standards adhered to
* Accessibility guidelines applied

## Approval and Sign Off

Record approvers, required signatures, and review cycle.

## Review and Approval

Include reviewers, approvers, and date of final acceptance.

## Example

```text
### Purpose
Ensure all documentation is compliant with organizational, regulatory, and technical standards prior to publication.

### Documentation Style Checklist
- Formatting reviewed against MokoStandards
- Headings verified for correct structure (starting at h2 where applicable)
- Metadata block present and accurate
- Terminology validated against organizational glossary
- All links tested and functional
- No banned punctuation or restricted characters detected

### Compliance Checklist
- SPDX header verified for accuracy and proper placement
- Licensing validated against project governance policy
- Tennessee jurisdictional compliance confirmed where relevant
- Security standards (authentication, data handling) reviewed
- Accessibility checks performed, including contrast and screen reader compatibility

### Approval and Sign Off
Documentation Lead, Compliance Officer

### Review and Approval
Governance Team, Architecture Lead
```

## Metadata

```
Owner: Documentation Lead
Reviewers: Governance, Architecture, Operations
Status: Active
Last Updated: <YYYY-MM-DD>
```
